edu.rit.numeric
Class Interpolation

java.lang.Object
  edu.rit.numeric.Interpolation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Function
public class Interpolation
extends Object
implements Function

Class Interpolation provides an object for interpolating in an XYSeries of real values (type double). Linear interpolation is used.

Class Interpolation implements interface Function. An instance of class Interpolation can be used as a function object.

Constructor Summary
Interpolation(XYSeries theSeries)
          Construct a new interpolation object that will interpolate between values in the given X-Y series.
 
Method Summary
 double f(double x)
          Using linear interpolation, compute the Y value for the given X value.
 double fInv(double y)
          Using linear interpolation, compute the X value for the given Y value.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Interpolation

public Interpolation(XYSeries theSeries)
Construct a new interpolation object that will interpolate between values in the given X-Y series. The X-Y series must have at least two elements.

Note: A copy of the given series' elements is made. Changing theSeries will not affect this interpolation object.

Parameters:
theSeries - X-Y series.
Throws:
NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theSeries is null.
IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if theSeries has fewer than two elements.
Method Detail

f

public double f(double x)
Using linear interpolation, compute the Y value for the given X value. It is assumed that the X values in the underlying X-Y series form a strictly increasing sequence.

If x is less than the smallest X value in the underlying X-Y series, the Y value is computed by extrapolating the first interval. If x is greater than the largest X value in the underlying X-Y series, the Y value is computed by extrapolating the last interval.

Specified by:
f in interface Function
Parameters:
x - X value.
Returns:
Interpolated or extrapolated Y value.

fInv

public double fInv(double y)
Using linear interpolation, compute the X value for the given Y value. It is assumed that the Y values in the underlying X-Y series form a strictly increasing sequence.

If y is less than the smallest Y value in the underlying X-Y series, the X value is computed by extrapolating the first interval. If y is greater than the largest Y value in the underlying X-Y series, the X value is computed by extrapolating the last interval.

Parameters:
y - Y value.
Returns:
Interpolated or extrapolated X value.
